messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: While enjoying her morning coffee at around 7:45 AM on 12/7/2024, Miss Clara Thompson, living at 1982 CherryBloom Way, noticed her Garden SHED open. Rattled, she dialed from her landline, number 55-3841, to the Hilltown Sheriff's Department. Not knowing What category it fell into, they registered her complaint under item 16-7890-02, denoting the vague descriptor: 23:15 - Suspicious Activity. For Identification purposes, the confusingly tagged code 87612 - UNCLEAR was given.  Detective J. Robbins, while finishing some Donuts with Detective Sergeant Farrow, headed to the said address. Robbins' first remark upon observing the scene was about the footprints, Odd Shoe size, but clear Tread.  Technical expert, Miss Dana Craig, from the Crime Scene Division, was On the scene faster than the Detectives thought possible. Around 9:20 AM, she managed to lift a rather Smudged fingerprint from the shed's handle. A crumpled note, with the scribble Meet at dusk, was found under a spade.  Mr. Richard Wallis, a Neighbor from 1984 CherryBloom, approached Robbins. Last night, A figure. Can't say who. Dark clothes, Tall-ish? Might've seen them near Clara's fence. Not Sure, though, he offered.  Using this Confusing array of clues, by 4 PM, the investigative team was led towards a local handyman, Tom Gregory, known to have worked at several homes in Hilltown. His shoe size? An odd match. Further investigation became IMPERATIVE.  Taking Wallis' shaky account, the fingerprint which was yet to give a definite Match, and the odd note from the shed, the incident spiraled into a series of question marks, prompting a more In-depth look into Tom Gregory's recent activities.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Detective J. Robbins Officer Context: Detective J. Robbins, while finishing some donuts with Detective Sergeant Farrow, headed to the address provided by Miss Clara Thompson. Robbins made a remark about the footprints he observed at the scene. Mr. Richard Wallis, a neighbor, approached Robbins to provide some information. Officer Role: Detective  Officer Name: Detective Sergeant Farrow Officer Context: Detective J. Robbins and Detective Sergeant Farrow went together to the address after hearing about the suspicious activity reported by Miss Clara Thompson. Officer Role: Detective Sergeant  Officer Name: Miss Dana Craig Officer Context: Miss Dana Craig, a technical expert from the Crime Scene Division, arrived at the scene to investigate. Around 9:20 AM, she managed to lift a fingerprint from the shed's handle and discovered a crumpled note. Officer Role: Technician
